meta_info: ::id DF-199-192909-666_9414.1 ::date 2013-08-21T08:26:03 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt in an article in toronto's "globe and mail" newspaper, John Polanyi, a Nobel laureate and member of the Department of Chemistry at the University of Toronto, recommends that afghanistan farmers be allowed(you might even say "be encouraged") to grow poppies (opium) legally. # ::save-date Tue Sep 15, 2015 ::file DF-199-192909-666_9414_1.txt
sentence: in an article in toronto's "globe and mail" newspaper, John Polanyi, a Nobel laureate and member of the Department of Chemistry at the University of Toronto, recommends that afghanistan farmers be allowed(you might even say "be encouraged") to grow poppies (opium) legally.

meta_info: ::id DF-199-192909-666_9414.2 ::date 2013-08-22T10:04:11 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt he argues that there is a shortage of painkilling medication, particularly in poor, third world countries, and that afghanistan could supply the needed poppies at a lower price than commercially produced painkillers. # ::save-date Sat Oct 7, 2017 ::file DF-199-192909-666_9414_2.txt
sentence: he argues that there is a shortage of painkilling medication, particularly in poor, third world countries, and that afghanistan could supply the needed poppies at a lower price than commercially produced painkillers.

meta_info: ::id DF-199-192909-666_9414.3 ::date 2013-08-22T12:33:47 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt i saw the interview he gave on CBC-TV recently and he seems to know what he is talking about. # ::save-date Tue Aug 27, 2013 ::file DF-199-192909-666_9414_3.txt
sentence: i saw the interview he gave on CBC-TV recently and he seems to know what he is talking about.

meta_info: ::id DF-199-192909-666_9414.4 ::date 2013-08-22T10:09:22 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt as he put it : "the afghan farmer has to make a living to feed his - often large - family. # ::save-date Wed May 7, 2014 ::file DF-199-192909-666_9414_4.txt
sentence: as he put it : "the afghan farmer has to make a living to feed his - often large - family.

meta_info: ::id DF-199-192909-666_9414.5 ::date 2013-08-22T10:39:34 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt we can force him to produce the poppies illegally and feed into the illegal drug market or we can buy the poppies from him and help provide pain-killing drugs." # ::save-date Fri Aug 14, 2015 ::file DF-199-192909-666_9414_5.txt
sentence: we can force him to produce the poppies illegally and feed into the illegal drug market or we can buy the poppies from him and help provide pain-killing drugs."

meta_info: ::id DF-199-192909-666_9414.6 ::date 2013-08-22T11:04:12 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt as i posted sometime ago, countries such as :france, australia and india are permitted to grow poppies legally for the production of drugs - why not allow the afghan farmers the same privilege ? # ::save-date Fri Jan 8, 2016 ::file DF-199-192909-666_9414_6.txt
sentence: as i posted sometime ago, countries such as :france, australia and india are permitted to grow poppies legally for the production of drugs - why not allow the afghan farmers the same privilege ?

meta_info: ::id DF-199-192909-666_9414.8 ::date 2013-08-21T08:27:58 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt The problem with poppy cultivation isn't the growing of the crop itself. # ::save-date Thu Dec 7, 2017 ::file DF-199-192909-666_9414_8.txt

meta_info: ::id DF-199-192909-666_9414.9 ::date 2013-08-21T08:32:27 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt The problem is oversight and marketing. # ::save-date Wed Dec 20, 2017 ::file DF-199-192909-666_9414_9.txt
